jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Full-Stack & AI Systems (UAE)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role
We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to architect and scale Sully.ai’s platform-level agentic AI systems. This role combines full-stack engineering excellence with deep expertise in LLM-powered experiences. You’ll design, implement, and optimize core components across frontend, backend, and model integrations, while driving engineering direction in close collaboration with our co-founders. Your work will directly shape the reliability, speed, and cohesion of Sully.ai’s multi-agent ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities

  • Architect and implement cross-agent systems that power core Sully.ai experiences.

  • Build and scale full-stack product components using TypeScript/React and Python services.

  • Integrate LLMs into production workflows with strong contracts, observability, and test coverage.

  • Develop shared UI components and typed SDKs to unify cross-agent experiences.

  • Lead engineering direction, collaborating with founders and cross-functional stakeholders.

Hard Requirements

  • Senior-level full-stack experience in React, TypeScript, and Python.

  • Proven ability to design, ship, and scale LLM-powered applications.

  • Expertise in API design, streaming, and CI/CD pipelines.

  • Strong cloud infrastructure background (AWS, GCP, or Azure).

  • Track record of building reliable systems with measurable performance and error budgets.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience with WebRTC or audio-aware UI design.

  • Hands-on work with agentic AI frameworks.

  • History of creating design tokens, SDKs, or cross-agent platforms.

First-Month Focus

  • Audit current cross-agent flows for UI/UX cohesion.

  • Implement shared components and typed contracts for reliability.

  • Establish instrumentation for frontend performance and model round-trip tracing.

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Deliver end-to-end tested, production-grade agentic workflows with <5% error rates.

  • Launch cross-agent design system and SDK used by at least 2 internal teams.

  • Establish weekly “deploy and measure” cadence with performance metrics and error budgets.

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments

Why Join Sully.ai?
🔥 Shape the Future of Healthcare: Build category-defining partnerships that enable doctors to focus on saving lives.
📈 Early-Stage Impact: Join early and play a critical role in shaping our partnership roadmap and overall company growth.
🌎 Remote-First Culture: Work with a talented, mission-driven team in a flexible, remote environment.
💰 Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary, equity, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
🏆 Solve Scalability Challenges: Tackle complex challenges in a rapidly growing company, driving impactful change in healthcare.

Sully.ai is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. Sully.ai prohibits any form of workplace harassment.

jobs.title: General Manager, United States
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role

We are seeking a General Manager for the United States market here at Sully.ai. We’re looking for someone who is:

  1. A seasoned operator and has led U.S. operations for B2B SaaS, healthtech or mission-driven AI companies from 0 to scale.

  2. You have experience scaling from early market pilots to enterprise adoption. You combine product fluency, commercial rigor, and domain empathy for healthcare and AI to translate agent innovations into clinician workflows.

  3. You thrive under ambiguity and can simultaneously manage high-stakes relationships and internal execution.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead Sully.ai’s U.S. operations as the end-to-end owner of: growth, execution, client delivery, and stakeholder alignment across Sales, Success, Implementation, and Strategic Partnerships.

  • Translate the product/agent roadmap into U.S. go-to-market execution: prioritize which agents (Receptionist, Scribe, Interpreter, Decision Support) to scale first, orchestrate cross-functional launches, and ensure U.S. regulatory/compliance readiness.

  • Be the bridge between Sully’s engineering/agents base and U.S. customers: manage escalations, negotiate enterprise contracts, and ensure high reliability and adoption in pilot and scale phases.

Hard Requirements

  • Proven U.S. Enterprise SaaS Operating Experience: Business leader (GM, SVP, Head of Region) in a hyper growth enterprise AI/SaaS company scaling U.S. operations, with demonstrated success in growth, retention, or market expansion.

  • Full P&L Ownership & Financial Acumen: Required to manage revenue targets, margins, forecasting, budgeting, and financial modeling for a U.S. business unit—able to translate high-level strategy into P&L performance.

  • Cross-Functional Execution & Scaling Track Record: Demonstrated ability to align and lead Sales, Success, Implementation, Partnerships, and Product/Engineering in a high-growth environment; must have launched repeated cross-functional initiatives or go-to-market campaigns.

  • High Bias to Speed, Ambiguity Tolerance & Strategic Judgment: Has a track record delivering under uncertainty, making tradeoffs, and accelerating cycles (e.g. compressing sales), without sacrificing quality—able to push back and defend necessary constraints.

Nice-to-Have

  • Successfully launched a new product/agent in the U.S. and scaled it to tens or hundreds of clients, exceeding target revenue consistently.

  • Improved retention, expansion, or adoption metrics at scale in health, telehealth, or B2B SaaS environments.

  • Demonstrated ability to move fast to resolve operational blockers, crisis-manage escalations, or turn around challenging pilot accounts.

First-Month Focus

  • Operationalize U.S. execution & unblock pipelines — establish weekly U.S. performance dashboard (sales, onboarding, implementation) and drive resolution of top 5 deal-blocking escalations to < 48h.

  • Drive early enterprise client traction & contract velocity — close at least one pilot enterprise contract ($1M+ ARR) within 30 days and reduce average sales cycle to ≤ 10 weeks for that pilot group.

  • Define & land a go-to-market agent prioritization roadmap — pick which agents (e.g., Receptionist, Scribe) to scale first in the U.S., and get alignment + approval across Product, Sales, and Compliance by day 30.

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Close $100M in Contracted ARR

  • 40% Billed ARR Month over Month Growth

  • 40% Revenue Month over Month Growth

  • 100% Contracted Month over Month Growth

  • Cost Control & Increase Profitability by 30%+

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments

Why Join Sully.ai?
🔥 Shape the Future of Healthcare: Build category-defining partnerships that enable doctors to focus on saving lives.
📈 Early-Stage Impact: Join early and play a critical role in shaping our partnership roadmap and overall company growth.
🌎 Remote-First Culture: Work with a talented, mission-driven team in a flexible, remote environment.
💰 Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary, equity, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
🏆 Solve Scalability Challenges: Tackle complex challenges in a rapidly growing company, driving impactful change in healthcare.

Sully.ai is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. Sully.ai prohibits any form of workplace harassment.

jobs.title: Head of Engineering, Decision Support
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role
We are seeking a Head of Engineering, Decision Support to lead the productization of ML/LLM models in mission-critical healthcare contexts. This role will own the design and delivery of decision support systems that are reliable, explainable, and trusted by clinicians. You will build and scale a team focused on inference pipelines, observability, and safety while ensuring measurable improvements in throughput, latency, and quality. As a technical leader, you will work cross-functionally with leadership, compliance, and integration teams to ensure our AI-driven decision support delivers real-world clinical impact.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the productization of ML/LLM-powered decision support systems with strict quality, safety, and latency benchmarks.

  • Build and scale engineering teams with a strong observability and reliability culture.

  • Design and launch inference pipelines with fallbacks, caching, A/B evaluation, and rollback capabilities.

  • Collaborate with clinicians, compliance experts, and cross-functional leaders to ensure interpretability, auditability, and clinical trust in deployed systems.

  • Drive innovation in agentic workflows (e.g., recommendations, triage, treatment support) that balance automation with safety.

Hard Requirements

  • Proven leadership in shipping ML/LLM systems with measurable quality, latency, and reliability outcomes.

  • Deep experience in decision support contexts, including agentic or recommendation systems.

  • Expertise building production-grade inference pipelines with safety, caching, and evaluation frameworks.

  • Exceptional communicator able to align technical and clinical stakeholders.

  • Team builder with a track record of establishing observability-first engineering practices.

Nice-to-Have

  • Familiarity with healthcare data standards (FHIR, HL7) and clinical reasoning patterns.

  • Experience working with EHR integrations and compliance-sensitive systems.

  • Background in explainable AI, interpretability, or audit trails for clinician-facing tools.

First-Month Focus

  • Audit existing decision support infrastructure and identify reliability/latency bottlenecks.

  • Establish engineering standards for observability, fallbacks, and A/B evaluation pipelines.

  • Partner with the EHR Integrations team on upcoming FHIR-driven workflows (Q4 2025).

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Launch and monitor production inference pipelines with measurable improvements in latency and throughput.

  • Deliver first decision support use case with clinical interpretability and audit features enabled.

  • Hire and onboard core engineering talent to scale decision support initiatives.

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments

Why Join Sully.ai?
🔥 Shape the Future of Healthcare: Build category-defining partnerships that enable doctors to focus on saving lives.
📈 Early-Stage Impact: Join early and play a critical role in shaping our partnership roadmap and overall company growth.
🌎 Remote-First Culture: Work with a talented, mission-driven team in a flexible, remote environment.
💰 Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary, equity, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
🏆 Solve Scalability Challenges: Tackle complex challenges in a rapidly growing company, driving impactful change in healthcare.

Sully.ai is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. Sully.ai prohibits any form of workplace harassment.

About the Role
We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to architect and scale Sully.ai’s platform-level agentic AI systems. This role combines full-stack engineering excellence with deep expertise in LLM-powered experiences. You’ll design, implement, and optimize core components across frontend, backend, and model integrations, while driving engineering direction in close collaboration with our co-founders. Your work will directly shape the reliability, speed, and cohesion of Sully.ai’s multi-agent ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities

  • Architect and implement cross-agent systems that power core Sully.ai experiences.

  • Build and scale full-stack product components using TypeScript/React and Python services.

  • Integrate LLMs into production workflows with strong contracts, observability, and test coverage.

  • Develop shared UI components and typed SDKs to unify cross-agent experiences.

  • Lead engineering direction, collaborating with founders and cross-functional stakeholders.

Hard Requirements

  • Senior-level full-stack experience in React, TypeScript, and Python.

  • Proven ability to design, ship, and scale LLM-powered applications.

  • Expertise in API design, streaming, and CI/CD pipelines.

  • Strong cloud infrastructure background (AWS, GCP, or Azure).

  • Track record of building reliable systems with measurable performance and error budgets.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience with WebRTC or audio-aware UI design.

  • Hands-on work with agentic AI frameworks.

  • History of creating design tokens, SDKs, or cross-agent platforms.

First-Month Focus

  • Audit current cross-agent flows for UI/UX cohesion.

  • Implement shared components and typed contracts for reliability.

  • Establish instrumentation for frontend performance and model round-trip tracing.

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Deliver end-to-end tested, production-grade agentic workflows with <5% error rates.

  • Launch cross-agent design system and SDK used by at least 2 internal teams.

jobs.title: General Manager, KSA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role
We are seeking a General Manager to launch and scale Sully.ai’s operations in Saudi Arabia. As our first in-market leader for KSA, you will own end-to-end P&L responsibility, drive go-to-market execution, and build a high-performing local team. Reporting directly to the COO, you will lead strategy formulation, government engagement, and operational excellence to establish Sully.ai as a healthcare technology leader in Saudi Arabia.

Key Responsibilities

  • Strategic Planning & Execution: Define and implement Sully.ai’s KSA go-to-market strategy to drive rapid adoption and growth.

  • Operational Leadership: Oversee all local operations (sales, partnerships, customer success, finance, HR) ensuring alignment with Sully.ai’s global standards.

  • Financial Management: Own full P&L responsibility, optimize expenses, and ensure financial discipline while driving aggressive revenue targets.

  • Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain strong relationships with hospitals, regulators, government agencies, and key partners.

  • Market Expansion: Conduct market analysis, identify new growth opportunities, and adapt Sully.ai’s offerings to meet Saudi healthcare needs.

  • Regulatory Compliance: Ensure compliance with Saudi corporate, licensing, and healthcare regulations.

Hard Requirements

  • 7+ years in a senior general management, country head, or regional leadership role.

  • Proven track record scaling B2B SaaS or AI businesses, ideally in the Middle East.

  • Strong financial acumen with hands-on P&L ownership.

  • Deep understanding of the Saudi healthcare ecosystem and regulatory environment.

  • Bilingual proficiency: English (required), Arabic (strongly preferred).

  • Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills.

Nice-to-Have

  • MBA or advanced degree in Business, Finance, or Economics.

  • Experience launching and scaling startups or new-market entries.

  • Established network across Saudi healthcare, government, and private sectors.

First-Month Focus

  • Establish relationships with Saudi government bodies, regulators, and healthcare providers.

  • Define a Saudi-specific growth strategy aligned with Sully.ai’s global objectives.

  • Hire and onboard the first local team members to build foundational operations.

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Launch Saudi operations with first signed customer contracts.

  • Secure 3–5 strategic partnerships with hospitals, clinics, or regulators.

  • Build a high-performing local team and operational playbook for scaling.

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments

Why Join Sully.ai?
🔥 Shape the Future of Healthcare: Build category-defining partnerships that enable doctors to focus on saving lives.
📈 Early-Stage Impact: Join early and play a critical role in shaping our partnership roadmap and overall company growth.
🌎 Remote-First Culture: Work with a talented, mission-driven team in a flexible, remote environment.
💰 Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary, equity, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
🏆 Solve Scalability Challenges: Tackle complex challenges in a rapidly growing company, driving impactful change in healthcare.

Sully.ai is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. jobs.title: Implementations Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role
We are seeking an Implementations Lead to own Sully.ai’s EHR integration delivery. You will orchestrate agencies, EHR vendors, and internal teams to ship integrations on time with minimal engineering involvement. Technical API product experience is required. Early-stage, fast-moving startup execution is required. Healthcare background is ideal.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage agency-led EHR integration projects end to end from scoping to production cutover

  • Own vendor relationships with Epic, Cerner, Athenahealth and partner ecosystems with clear SLAs

  • Define and track OKRs such as implemented customers without engineering involvement and time to production

  • Compress delivery to under 3 months by controlling the critical path and removing blockers

  • Build the implementation function with CS including playbooks, runbooks, and customer-facing comms

Hard Requirements

  • 5+ years leading technical implementations or programs for API products

  • Proven delivery of integration projects using agencies or SI partners at scale

  • Early-stage startup operator who drives outcomes in ambiguity and speed

  • Expert project operations in Linear or Jira with dependency and risk management

  • Exceptional communication and stakeholder management with customers and vendors

Nice-to-Have

  • Ex-founder or founding team experience

  • Healthcare integrations across EHR, FHIR, HL7

  • Background in technical customer success or solutions architecture

First-Month Focus

  • Audit the EHR pipeline, active agency projects, and vendor access requirements

  • Map no-engineering implementation paths with CS and define acceptance criteria

  • Publish v1 implementation playbook and dashboards for cycle time and on-time delivery

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Deliver 5 new integrations to production with median time under 90 days

  • Implement 20–30 customers with 100% no engineering involvement for standard paths

  • Achieve 90% or higher on-time delivery and 95% or higher vendor SLA adherence

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments

Why Join Sully.ai?
🔥 Shape the Future of Healthcare: Build category-defining partnerships that enable doctors to focus on saving lives.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. jobs.title: Head of Engineering, Scribe
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role

We are seeking a Head of Engineering at Sully.ai to own the evolution of our AI Scribe Agent. You will lead the Scribe engineering team at Sully.ai, owning end-to-end velocity, metrics, and quality for clinical note generation and decision support.

Your mission: Slash latency (note generation, decision support) by at least 50%, build ultra-robust observability and model-selection systems, and deliver flawless, 100% reliable output under high scale and tight deadlines. You’ll fight for engineering best practices, push back where quality is at risk, and set the bar for speed, precision, and operational excellence across the Scribe product stack.

Key Responsibilities

  • Align engineering team priorities by mapping dependencies, timelines, and deliverables.

  • Facilitate and run daily/weekly Scribe standups to ensure progress, remove blockers, and sync cross-functional updates.

  • Oversee and manage the Scribe team’s Linear board, prioritizing and assigning tasks each week for clarity and execution.

  • Operationalize continuous note quality evaluation for improvement.

Hard Requirements

  • Proven Track Record Reducing Latency & Improving Throughput: 5+ years engineering leadership or senior engineering experience.

  • Strong Observability & Metrics Instrumentation Experience: Must have built dashboards, error / alerting pipelines, tracing/logging systems; comfortable selecting and integrating model selection and monitoring tools.

  • System Ownership in Integration & Reliability: Experience owning end-to-end reliability for critical systems (e.g., audio transcription, note output, EHR integrations).

  • Strong Prioritization & Quality Emphasis: Responsibilities include code reviews, bug triage, and enforcing quality guardrails.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience with healthcare standards (FHIR / HL7) and EHR system quirks, although domain knowledge can be learned.

  • Prior exposure to real-time or almost real-time streaming or chunked audio processing / diarization, and converting unstructured speech inputs into structured outputs (e.g., JSON / markdown pipelines).

  • Experience leading teams that integrate with front-end and extension platforms (web, mobile, browser extension) to maintain consistency and crash resilience.

First-Month Focus

  • Own operability of the system: lead all Observability, define Metrics, and drive AI model selection.

  • Launch monitoring alerts for transcription failures to enable rapid incident responses.

  • Reduce average post-visit note editing time to under 2 minutes.

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  1. Ensure 100% reliability in the overall note-generation and support workflow.

  2. Increase the speed of Decision Support workflows by 50%.

  3. Integrate the note evaluation pipeline into weekly CI/CD, analyzing completeness and physician-level errors.

  4. Modernize legacy EHR integrations by refactoring or wrapping outdated systems, adding FHIR/API interfaces, and ensuring interoperability with current workflows.

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver. Loves getting in the trenches.

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments

  • Zero to One Builder, self-managed and self-directed

Why Join Sully.ai?
🔥 Shape the Future of Healthcare: Build category-defining partnerships that enable doctors to focus on saving lives.
📈 Early-Stage Impact: Join early and play a critical role in shaping our partnership roadmap and overall company growth.
🌎 Remote-First Culture: Work with a talented, mission-driven team in a flexible, remote environment.
💰 Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary, equity, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
🏆 Solve Scalability Challenges: Tackle complex challenges in a rapidly growing company, driving impactful change in healthcare.

Sully.ai is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. Sully.ai prohibits any form of workplace harassment.

jobs.title: Head of Engineering, QA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role
We are seeking a Head of Engineering, QA to build Sully.ai’s QA function from the ground up—owning strategy, automation, and execution. This is a 0→1 role: you’ll set the framework for functional, performance, and compliance testing, scale automation across our stack, and ensure our AI medical employees are safe, reliable, and high-performing. You will also recruit and mentor a team, embedding QA into CI/CD pipelines to enable fast, clinical-grade releases.

Key Responsibilities

  • Own QA strategy, defining frameworks for automation, functional, performance, and compliance testing

  • Build and scale Playwright-based test automation for UI and API coverage

  • Ensure reliability by expanding automation coverage, monitoring dashboards, and resolving test failures quickly

  • Guarantee accuracy, security, and compliance (HIPAA/SOC-2), partnering with Engineering and Clinical teams

  • Recruit, mentor, and lead a high-performing QA team

  • Embed QA into CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions and related tooling

Hard Requirements

  • Founder / 0→1 experience — first in function, building QA processes and teams from scratch

  • 6–8+ years in QA with strong expertise in Playwright

  • 3–4+ years of people leadership experience

  • Proven ability to automate functional UI and API test cases

  • Hands-on with QA tools (Playwright, Cypress, PyTest, Postman)

  • Experience scaling test automation and maintaining reliability

  • Highly motivated, driven, and ownership-oriented

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience testing AI/LLM workflows

  • Familiarity with dashboarding and observability tooling

  • GitHub Actions CI/CD integration experience

  • Prior startup or healthcare QA background

First-Month Focus

  • Define Sully.ai’s QA strategy and initial automation framework

  • Implement core Playwright test cases across key workflows

  • Partner with Engineering and Clinical teams to validate compliance needs

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Establish automated test coverage across UI and API workflows

  • Integrate QA pipelines into GitHub Actions for reliable CI/CD

  • Deliver measurable improvements in test reliability and release confidence

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments

jobs.title: Ex-Founder
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role

We’re hiring exceptional technical founders, engineering leaders, and systems thinkers to join us on that mission.

Whether you’ve built core infrastructure from scratch, scaled technical teams, architected complex systems, or founded an AI-native company, we want to talk to you.

Why Founders?

We're not looking for people to slot into a rigid org chart—we’re looking for builders. You’ve designed systems from scratch, solved problems no one had a playbook for, worn multiple hats (IC, CTO, recruiter, PM) before lunch, and delivered impact under pressure.

Now you're ready to do it again with our mission of “One Human. One Doctor” and the belief that access to a doctor is a basic human right.

What You'll Do

As a key leader at Sully.ai, you’ll take full ownership of building and scaling a core function of the business, from getting into the weeds to strategy and execution. You won’t be stepping into a fully built machine, you’ll be designing the machine, testing it, and building the team that runs it. This is a hands-on leadership role for someone who thrives in fast-moving environments and knows how to turn ambiguity into action. We are remote (with quarterly travel to our Mountain View office if not local).

Each of these roles will lead the creation of their respective function. While scope will differ by role, you’ll likely be doing things like:

  • Architect Critical Systems: Build foundational infrastructure for our AI pipelines, real-time inference systems, EHR integrations, or clinical interfaces.

  • Scale Engineering: Establish engineering practices, hiring pipelines, and technical processes that support speed without sacrificing stability.

  • Drive Technical Strategy: Evaluate trade-offs, make build-vs-buy decisions, and define our technical direction across AI, data, backend, and platform layers.

  • Collaborate Across Functions: Partner closely with product, clinical, sales, and operations to align engineering work with real-world outcomes.

  • Stay Close to Users: Build with the end-user in mind, understanding clinician workflows, latency constraints, and clinical safety requirements.

What You'll Bring

  • Founder DNA: You’ve built and scaled something from zero, likely as a founder or co-founder. You know how to move fast, juggle priorities, and rally a team around a shared vision. You've hired, sold, shipped, and pitched - all in the same day.

  • Builder’s Mindset: You’re excited by ambiguity and energized by action. You don’t wait for permission - you move, test, learn, and improve. You’ve built playbooks, systems, and teams that turned early traction into scalable growth.

  • Cross-Functional Fluency: Whether it’s working with product, engineering, ops, or marketing, you’re comfortable collaborating across disciplines to drive outcomes. You know how to bridge business goals with technical realities.

  • Customer-Centric Thinking: No matter your function, you stay close to the customer. You’re obsessed with delivering value, solving real problems, and measuring impact through data and feedback.

  • Startup-Ready Energy: You’re available during core working hours (6am–6pm PT) and thrive in fast-paced, distributed environments. You know how to prioritize what matters most and move quickly without losing focus on quality.

About the Compensation

As this is a unique opportunity within Sully, we will discuss the compensation during our first call with you.

Why Join Sully.ai?
🔥 Shape the Future of Healthcare: Build category-defining partnerships that enable doctors to focus on saving lives.
📈 Early-Stage Impact: Join early and play a critical role in shaping our partnership roadmap and overall company growth.
🌎 Remote-First Culture: Work with a talented, mission-driven team in a flexible, remote environment.
💰 Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary, equity, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
🏆 Solve Scalability Challenges: Tackle complex challenges in a rapidly growing company, driving impactful change in healthcare.

Sully.ai is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. Sully.ai prohibits any form of workplace harassment.

jobs.title: Applied Research Scientist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role
We are seeking an Applied Research Scientist to design and run rigorous experiments for LLM-based agents, with a focus on clinical and agentic reliability. This role will own the development of automated evaluation frameworks, bridging research prototypes into production systems, and partnering closely with product and engineering to ensure safety, robustness, and measurable impact.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and run experiments to measure accuracy, robustness, and hallucination rates in LLM agents.

  • Build automated evaluation pipelines (LLM-as-judge + human review) with clinical-grade benchmarks.

  • Partner with Research Ops/IRB to design efficacy studies and align with regulatory requirements.

  • Translate research into production-ready evaluation systems, collaborating with engineering to land features 0→1.

  • Develop error taxonomies, ablations, and guardrails to ensure safe and reliable agent behaviors.

Hard Requirements

  • Proven experience designing agentic processes and LLM evaluation/benchmarking frameworks.

  • Strong Python and ML background (PyTorch/TensorFlow, Hugging Face, LangChain/LlamaIndex).

  • Demonstrated ability to design rigorous experiments and translate findings into production.

  • Track record of published research or deep applied work in LLMs and agent evaluation.

  • Strong communication and technical writing skills to articulate complex findings clearly.

Nice-to-Have

  • Prior work in healthcare/clinical NLP with awareness of medical data standards.

  • Experience running IRB-aligned or clinical-grade studies.

  • Exposure to noisy/limited medical data and designing strategies to overcome constraints.

First-Month Focus

  • Audit existing evaluation approaches for clinical and agentic tasks.

  • Define initial benchmarks and build early automated pipelines.

  • Partner with engineering to land first set of CI gates for accuracy, factuality, and safety.

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Deliver a repeatable evaluation framework with automated pipelines in production.

  • Demonstrate measurable improvements in robustness, hallucination reduction, or safety.

  • Publish or present internal research findings that directly shape product reliability.

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments

Why Join Sully.ai?
🔥 Shape the Future of Healthcare: Build category-defining partnerships that enable doctors to focus on saving lives.

jobs.title: Head of Success
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
👏 Team from OpenAI, DeepMind, NASA, GoogleX, Tesla, and 2 physicians: 6 exits, 2 IPOs.
🔥 Our model outperforms Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.5 on clinical benchmarks.
📈 400+ healthcare orgs signed in 16 months.
⚡️ $25M raised from YC, Amity Ventures, Sequoia scouts, and more.
🌎 $1T+ market opportunity. We’re going after all of it.

About the Role
We are seeking a Head of Customer Success to own Sully.ai’s retention, expansion, and post-sales execution. You will build the Success org from scratch, systematize onboarding and advocacy, and translate frontline clinician feedback into product priorities.

Key Responsibilities

  • Stand up the Success org, metrics, and playbooks. Own NRR, GRR, churn, expansions.

  • Design enterprise onboarding and health scoring for faster time to value.

  • Run executive relationships and renewals across complex health systems.

  • Close the loop from customer signal to roadmap. Drive product via structured feedback.

  • Build dashboards in Salesforce or Gainsight. Forecast retention and expansion.

Hard Requirements

  • 5+ years leading customer success or post-sales for API or technical SaaS.

  • Owned $10–50M+ ARR with clear NRR, GRR, churn, and upsell metrics.

  • Proven builder of playbooks, segmentation, and health scoring.

  • Enterprise relationship management with C-suite and clinical stakeholders.

  • Strong cross-functional operator with Product, Sales, and Engineering.

Nice-to-Have

  • Ex-founder background or 0→1 org build.

  • Healthcare or regulated industry experience. HIPAA familiarity.

  • Gainsight administration and advanced Salesforce reporting.

First-Month Focus

  • Audit accounts, renewals, risks, and expansion pipeline. Publish health scores.

  • Ship v1 Success playbook: onboarding, QBRs, escalation, renewal steps.

  • Align product feedback loop. Define decision rights and SLAs with Product and CS.

Success OKRs (90 Days)

  • Company-level NRR ≥120% and GRR ≥95%.

  • Median time to value cut by 30%. Health score coverage at 100%.

  • ≥90% on-time renewals with executive sponsors named for top 50 accounts.

Culture Fit

  • Persistent, driven problem solver

  • Willing to push back on leadership to defend quality/timelines

  • Thrives in high-ambiguity, fast-paced startup environments
